refsynopsisdiv.title: Methods
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: SetUserName(in's'name) SetRealName(in's'name) SetEmail(in's'email) SetLanguage(in's'language) SetXSession(in's'x_session) SetLocation(in's'location) SetHomeDirectory(in's'homedir) SetShell(in's'shell) SetIconFile(in's'filename) SetLocked(in'b'locked) SetAccountType(in'i'accountType) SetPasswordMode(in'i'mode) SetPassword(in's'password, in's'hint) SetAutomaticLogin(in'b'enabled)

refsect1.title: Implemented Interfaces
refsect1.para: Objects implementing org.freedesktop.Accounts.User also implements org.freedesktop.DBus.Introspectable, org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties

refsect2.title: SetUserName ()
refsect2.para: Sets the users username. Note that it is usually not allowed to have multiple users with the same username.

listitem.simpara: if the caller lacks the appropriate PolicyKit authorization
if the operation failed

note.title: Permissions
note.para:
The caller needs one of the following PolicyKit authorizations:
org.freedesktop.accounts.user-administration: To change the username of any user

refsect2.title: SetRealName ()
refsect2.para: Sets the users real name.

listitem.para: The new name, typically in the form "Firstname Lastname".

listitem.simpara: if the caller lacks the appropriate PolicyKit authorization
if the operation failed

note.title: Permissions
note.para:
The caller needs one of the following PolicyKit authorizations:
org.freedesktop.accounts.change-own-user-data: To change his own name
org.freedesktop.accounts.user-administration: To change the name of another user

refsect2.title: SetEmail ()
refsect2.para: Sets the users email address.
Note that setting an email address in the AccountsService is not the same as configuring a mail client. Mail clients might default to email address that is configured here, though.

listitem.simpara: if the caller lacks the appropriate PolicyKit authorization
if the operation failed

note.title: Permissions
note.para:
The caller needs one of the following PolicyKit authorizations:
org.freedesktop.accounts.change-own-user-data: To change his own email address
org.freedesktop.accounts.user-administration: To change the email address of another user

refsect2.title: SetLanguage ()
refsect2.para: Sets the users language.
The expectation is that display managers will start the users session with this locale.

listitem.para: The new language, as a locale specification like "de_DE.UTF-8".

listitem.simpara: if the caller lacks the appropriate PolicyKit authorization
if the operation failed

note.title: Permissions
note.para:
The caller needs one of the following PolicyKit authorizations:
org.freedesktop.accounts.change-own-user-data: To change his own language
org.freedesktop.accounts.user-administration: To change the language of another user

refsect2.title: SetXSession ()
refsect2.para: Sets the users x session.
The expectation is that display managers will log the user in to this specified session, if available.

listitem.simpara: if the caller lacks the appropriate PolicyKit authorization
if the operation failed

note.title: Permissions
note.para:
The caller needs one of the following PolicyKit authorizations:
org.freedesktop.accounts.change-own-user-data: To change his own language
org.freedesktop.accounts.user-administration: To change the language of another user

refsect2.title: SetLocation ()
refsect2.para: Sets the users location.

listitem.para: The new location as a freeform string.

listitem.simpara: if the caller lacks the appropriate PolicyKit authorization
if the operation failed

note.title: Permissions
note.para:
The caller needs one of the following PolicyKit authorizations:
org.freedesktop.accounts.change-own-user-data: To change his own location
org.freedesktop.accounts.user-administration: To change the location of another user

refsect2.title: SetHomeDirectory ()
refsect2.para: Sets the users home directory.
Note that changing the users home directory moves all the content from the old location to the new one, and is potentially an expensive operation.

listitem.para: The new homedir as an absolute path.

listitem.simpara: if the caller lacks the appropriate PolicyKit authorization
if the operation failed

note.title: Permissions
note.para:
The caller needs one of the following PolicyKit authorizations:
org.freedesktop.accounts.user-administration: To change the home directory of a user

refsect2.title: SetShell ()
refsect2.para: Sets the users shell.
Note that setting the shell to a non-allowed program may prevent the user from logging in.

listitem.simpara: if the caller lacks the appropriate PolicyKit authorization
if the operation failed

note.title: Permissions
note.para:
The caller needs one of the following PolicyKit authorizations:
org.freedesktop.accounts.user-administration: To change the shell of a user

refsect2.title: SetIconFile ()
refsect2.para: Sets the users icon.

listitem.para: The absolute filename of a png file to use as the users icon.

listitem.simpara: if the caller lacks the appropriate PolicyKit authorization
if the operation failed

note.title: Permissions
note.para:
The caller needs one of the following PolicyKit authorizations:
org.freedesktop.accounts.change-own-user-data: To change his own icon
org.freedesktop.accounts.user-administration: To change the icon of another user

refsect2.title: SetLocked ()
refsect2.para: Locks or unlocks a users account.
Locking an account prevents the user from logging in.

listitem.para: Whether to lock or unlock the users account.

listitem.simpara: if the caller lacks the appropriate PolicyKit authorization
if the operation failed

note.title: Permissions
note.para:
The caller needs one of the following PolicyKit authorizations:
org.freedesktop.accounts.user-administration: To lock or unlock user accounts

refsect2.title: SetAccountType ()
refsect2.para: Changes the users account type.

listitem.para:
The new account type, encoded as an integer:
0: Standard user
1: Administrator

listitem.simpara: if the caller lacks the appropriate PolicyKit authorization
if the operation failed

note.title: Permissions
note.para:
The caller needs one of the following PolicyKit authorizations:
org.freedesktop.accounts.user-administration: To change an account type

refsect2.title: SetPasswordMode ()
refsect2.para: Changes the users password mode.
Note that changing the password mode has the side-effect of unlocking the account.

listitem.para:
The new password mode, encoded as an integer:
0: Regular password
1: Password must be set at next login
2: No password

listitem.simpara: if the caller lacks the appropriate PolicyKit authorization
if the operation failed

note.title: Permissions
note.para:
The caller needs one of the following PolicyKit authorizations:
org.freedesktop.accounts.user-administration: To change a users password mode

refsect2.title: SetPassword ()
refsect2.para: Sets a new password for this user.
Note that setting a password has the side-effect of unlocking the account.

listitem.simpara: if the caller lacks the appropriate PolicyKit authorization
if the operation failed

note.title: Permissions
note.para:
The caller needs one of the following PolicyKit authorizations:
org.freedesktop.accounts.user-administration: To change the password of a user

refsect2.title: SetAutomaticLogin ()
refsect2.para: Enables or disables automatic login for a user.
Note that usually only one user can have automatic login enabled, so turning it on for a user will disable it for the previously configured autologin user.

listitem.para: Whether to enable automatic login for this user.

listitem.simpara: if the caller lacks the appropriate PolicyKit authorization
if the operation failed

note.title: Permissions
note.para:
The caller needs one of the following PolicyKit authorizations:
org.freedesktop.accounts.set-login-option: To change the login screen configuration

refsect2.title: The Changed signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when the user is changed.

refsect2.title: The "Uid" property
refsect2.para: The uid of the user.

refsect2.title: The "UserName" property
refsect2.para: The username of the user.

refsect2.title: The "RealName" property
refsect2.para: The users real name.

refsect2.title: The "AccountType" property
refsect2.para:
The users account type, encoded as an integer:
0: Standard user
1: Administrator

refsect2.title: The "HomeDirectory" property
refsect2.para: The users home directory.

refsect2.title: The "Shell" property
refsect2.para: The users shell.

refsect2.title: The "Email" property
refsect2.para: The email address.

refsect2.title: The "Language" property
refsect2.para: The users language, as a locale specification like "de_DE.UTF-8".

refsect2.title: The "XSession" property
refsect2.para: The users x session.

refsect2.title: The "Location" property
refsect2.para: The users location.

refsect2.title: The "LoginFrequency" property
refsect2.para: How often the user has logged in.

refsect2.title: The "LoginTime" property
refsect2.para: The last login time.

refsect2.title: The "LoginHistory" property
refsect2.para: The login history for this user. Each entry in the array represents a login session. The first two members are the login time and logout time, as timestamps (seconds since the epoch). If the session is still running, the logout time is 0.
The a{sv} member is a dictionary containing additional information about the session. Possible members include 'type' (with values like ':0', 'tty0', 'pts/0' etc).

refsect2.title: The "IconFile" property
refsect2.para: The filename of a png file containing the users icon.

refsect2.title: The "Locked" property
refsect2.para: Whether the users account is locked.

refsect2.title: The "PasswordMode" property
refsect2.para:
The password mode for the user account, encoded as an integer:
0: Regular password
1: Password must be set at next login
2: No password

refsect2.title: The "PasswordHint" property
refsect2.para: The password hint for the user.

refsect2.title: The "AutomaticLogin" property
refsect2.para: Whether automatic login is enabled for the user.

refsect2.title: The "SystemAccount" property
refsect2.para: Whether this is a 'system' account, like 'root' or 'nobody'. System accounts should normally not appear in lists of users, and ListCachedUsers will not include such accounts.

refsect2.title: The "LocalAccount" property
refsect2.para: Whether the user is a local account or not.
